text:
Hi guys! I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen, I want to share with

you my Chocolate Crumb Cake Muffin recipe.
Now my husband really loves my - just my regular

crumb cake muffin recipe. I am a chocoholic,
so I figured I'd show you my chocolate version.

If you want to see his version, make sure
you let me know down below and I'll bring

it to you. But these are nonetheless so incredibly
good, I mean its like that crumbly streusel

topping - moistness. They're out of this world.
The ingredients you'll need are kind of basic

and simple. All purpose flour and cocoa powder
which I have sifted, instant coffee powder

or espresso powder, salt, baking soda and
baking powder, granulated sugar a couple of

eggs unsalted butter that has been softened
at room temperature, sour cream, milk and

in here for the topping I've got some cold
butter, flour, granulated sugar and brown

sugar and just a small little pinch of cinnamon
not much, but just to echo the chocolate.

Okay! It's very simple and straight forward.
I have my oven pre-heated to 375F and I have

a muffin tin lined with these really pretty
muffin liners. Side note: These kind of look

like beaks, right? Like a bird - beak of a
bird. Anyways, love them I am going to use

them today. In my standing mixer fitted with
my paddle attachment. I am going to add my

butter and sugar. I am going to cream those
together, while that's happening I am going

to go grab my vanilla, because I forgot to
get it out here. That looks good, just going

to scrape that side there. I am going to add
my eggs along with a splash of vanilla and

I'm going to beat those in until its nice
and fluffy and combined. Just going to lower

this and I am going to add my sour cream which
gives these an incredible tender moistness

to them. And my milk, I'm going to mix those
in and do not panic if this looks like it's

split, its just what it does. Traditionally,
if you are baking experts - supposed to do

in intervals, but my Nonna as you've seen
her do before mixes all the wet and then all

the dry, so that's what I do. and she's the
best cook and baker in the world. So, I just

follow her example. Going to mix my dry ingredients
just really really briefly, I am going to

pour them in here, or pour them - just add
them there in my wet mixture and I am just

going to. Oh that is a cloud of chocolate
- best cloud ever. Mix those in until everything

is just incorporated and then we'll be ready
to fill all our muffin liners and make our

topping. That looks amazing and I'm telling
you, it smells even better. Just going to

divide my mixture evenly using an ice cream
scoop. And then, it is time to make the topping

and then they'll go in the oven and then they'll
bake and then your house will smell amazing

and then you are going to stop what you're
doing to give me - send me a comment or an

email just to tell me how good your house
smells and then it will be that much closer

to eating them. Now this makes 12 big muffins,
but you could easily get 18 regular sized

muffins if you don't want to get them that
big. Now for the topping, I am just going

to mix these together with my spoon and then
I am just going to go with my pastry cutter

and just cut the butter in the flour and sugar
mixture. You want it to be really nice and

crumbly. That's exactly what I am looking
for and I am just going to mix them up and

then just sprinkle this on top of each one.
And these are going to go into your pre-heated

oven at 375F between 20 and 25 minutes or
until, you know cooked all the way through

and the easiest way to tell is you take a
toothpick and you insert into the center and

if it comes out clean with no wet batter on
it then you know, you are in business. I am

going to pop these in, let them cool for a
bit and show you what they look like when

they are done. My muffins baked for 20 minutes
and I've let them cool pretty much completely

and they are just how they should be. I am
just going to peel this off. Its crumbly up

top, look at that. Look - I mean - I just
love - I love the crumble - I love the streusel

topping, look at that. That is going to be
moist. On the money. That's a fantastic muffin.

Not at all overly sweet. You can really taste
the chocolate, you cannot taste the instant

espresso powder at all. But, it just makes
that chocolate taste really chocolaty, their

crust on the top is like the perfect ending
to this. This is just, its a really great,

great muffin recipe. Go to laurainthekitchen.com
to get the recipe. Hope you've enjoyed spending
time with me and I'll see you next time. Bye!
